channel.title: Does anyone have Windows 7 CLASSPATH and PATH codes?
channel.description: Really, because this is getting ridiculous.

item.title: Does anyone have Windows 7 CLASSPATH and PATH codes?
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Linksys Mr. Linksys
item.description:
@Mr_Linksys wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:2, topic:332875”]Name:CLASSPATH
Value:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_VERSION\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
And

Name:PATH
Value:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_VERSION\bin;
If JDK is installed in Program Files (x86) Than change that, and also change VERSION to your Jdk update version.[/quote]
Thanks bro! I shall give the some Rep++

Read full topic
item.source: Does anyone have Windows 7 CLASSPATH and PATH codes?

item.title: Does anyone have Windows 7 CLASSPATH and PATH codes?

item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote=“12igon8, post:5, topic:332875”]not working better, but so you dont have to change it under edit, idk, lazyness for me i guess[/quote]I think it’s even less lazy to figure out how to do the CLASSPATH and PATH instead of having to move around files every time you want to compile a project/file. (Or so I think that’s what you’re saying you do.)

you can do wut he said, but i recommend moving your java file out of program files x86 and butting them in regular, i got windows 7 and thats wut i did and works better when compiling and stuff

item.source: Does anyone have Windows 7 CLASSPATH and PATH codes?

item.title: Does anyone have Windows 7 CLASSPATH and PATH codes?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Name:CLASSPATH
Value:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_VERSION\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
And

Name:PATH
Value:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_VERSION\bin;
If JDK is installed in Program Files (x86) Than change that, and also change VERSION to your Jdk update version.

Read full topic
